content: How much of our lungs do we use when we breathe normally?

When we breathe normally, we use only a small portion of our lung capacity. The exact percentage can vary depending on factors such as age, fitness level, and overall health, but it's generally estimated that we use around 5-10% of our total lung capacity during regular breathing. This is because our bodies are highly efficient at extracting the oxygen we need from the air we inhale, so there's no need to utilize the full capacity of our lungs under normal circumstances.
